summary: This document is an email chain from August 6, 2019, between Jeffrey Epstein's attorney, Mariel Colon Miro, and a Supervisory Staff Attorney at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The attorney relays complaints from Epstein regarding lack of toilet paper, an unplugged CPAP machine, and limited, unmonitored phone calls. The MCC supervisor acknowledges the complaints and asks staff to check on the toilet paper and CPAP, while noting concern about the unrecorded phone calls.

keyFacts: On August 6, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
Epstein's attorney complained he had no toilet paper in his cell and his CPAP machine was not plugged in, preventing its use.
Since arriving at MCC, Epstein had only made two 15-minute phone calls, both on unmonitored lines, meaning there were no recordings.
A supervisory attorney at the MCC expressed specific concern about the two calls being on unmonitored lines.
The correspondence shows active legal representation and concern for Epstein's wellbeing in custody shortly before his death.
